The Company shall settle or reject a claim, as the case may be, within 15 days from the date of receipt of last necessary document. However, if circumstances warrant an investigation, it shall be completed within 30 days, and the claim shall be settled or rejected within 45 days from the date of receipt of last necessary document. 

You are required to submit the claim with full particulars within thirty days of date of discharge from hospital for reimbursement of hospitalisation, day care and pre hospitalisation expenses. 

Also, please note that the policy has a co-payment clause: 5% Co-pay on all claims for age less than equal to 75 years and 15% Co-pay on all claims for age greater than 75 years. 

The claim amount will be paid after deducting the co-payment. 

You may want to check with the insurer for additional documentation requirements.

No, the cataract treatment expenses are limited to up to 25% of the Sum Insured or Rs.40,000/-, whichever is lower, per eye, under one policy year. 

For example, if your Sum Insured is Rs200,000, the maximum payable for cataract treatment would be 25% of Rs200,000, which is Rs50,000, or Rs40,000, whichever is lower. 

In your case, the settlement would be limited to Rs40,000. 

Additionally, a co-payment of 5% for Insured Person aged less than or equal to 75 years or 15% for Insured Person aged greater than 75 years on policy inception will be applied to the claim amount.
